answers.answer: It's the only way to know, I think...?I took mine and got gestonial diabetes.. which I am surpriced to.. according to my book only 5% of women get it.Usually the ones in the risk group are those who has family with diabetes, over 35 of age, are overweight ..and from Asia region or Africa.I belong in none of these groups... yet my result claims I have it??I will find out more next week.I hope you dont have it, its a misery...good luck hun
Has this started in pregnancy?You could have something called gestational diabetes in that case.Many women get it. Inc myself.

That happened to me during the first 6 months of my pregnancy. It could just be a side effect of pregnancy. I do not have diabetes of any sort. I just could not handle sweets. There is a good chance your fine but the only way to really tell is when you take your glucose test.

question: Hey, so everytime after i eat anything with sugar i get bad migranes and i get so nauseous. i stay away from sodas n sweets but once in a while i want something sweet. is it possible im diabetic? We have a fam history of diabetes . :(
title: worried ....diabetes?
